intro: Thesium annuum, commonly known as the annual thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Thesium annuum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
